Strompris API¶

Fetch data from https://www.hvakosterstrommen.no/strompris-api and visualize it.

Assignment 5

strompris.fetch_day_prices(date: date = None, location: str = 'NO1') → DataFrame¶

Fetch one day of data for one location from hvakosterstrommen.no API

Parameters:

  • date (datetime.date) – The date for which to fetch prices. Defaults to the current date.

  • location (str) – The location for which to fetch prices. Defaults to “NO1” (Oslo).

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the electricity prices

for the specified date and location.

Return type:

df (DataFrame)

strompris.fetch_prices(end_date: date = None, days: int = 7, locations: list[str] = ('NO1', 'NO2', 'NO3', 'NO4', 'NO5')) → DataFrame¶

Fetch prices for multiple days and locations into a single DataFrame

Parameters:

  • end_date (datetime.date) – The end date of the time period. If not specified, defaults to today’s date.

  • days (int) – The number of days of data to fetch, up to and including the end date. Defaults to 7 days.

  • locations (list[str]) – A list of location codes (NO1, NO2, etc.) for which to fetch data. Defaults to all locations.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the electricity prices

for the specified time period and locations.

Return type:

df (DataFrame)

strompris.plot_prices(df: DataFrame) → Chart¶

Plots electricity prices over time for each location.

x-axis represents the time_start y-axis represents the price in NOK each location has its own line

Parameters:

df (DataFrame) – The DataFrame containing the electricity prices data.

Returns:

The chart representing the line plot of the data.

Return type:

chart (Altair.Chart)

strompris.plot_activity_prices(df: DataFrame, activity: str = 'shower', minutes: float = 10) → Chart¶

Plot price for one activity by name, given a data frame of prices, and its duration in minutes.

Parameters:

  • df (DataFrame) – A DataFrame containing electricity prices.

  • activity (str, optional) – The name of the activity to plot the price for. Defaults to “shower”.

  • minutes (float) – The duration of the activity in minutes. Defaults to 10 minutes.

Returns:

An Altair chart showing the price for the specified activity.

Return type:

alt.Chart
